Create the ending for this story
The man was walking down the street, trying to decide whether to go left or right, when he suddenly heard a voice calling him.

The man paused, his heart skipping a beat as the voice seemed to echo from nowhere and everywhere all at once. It was a soft, familiar voice, one he hadn't heard in years. He turned slowly, scanning the street for any sign of the speaker. The street was empty, shrouded in the golden glow of the setting sun, casting long shadows that danced around him.

As he stood there, trying to make sense of it all, the voice called again, this time more insistent and clearer, "Over here, John!" It was his sister, Emily, who had passed away many years ago. Confused but drawn by an overwhelming urge, he followed the voice, his feet guiding him as if they had a will of their own.

He walked towards a narrow alleyway, where the shadows seemed to deepen. At the end of the alley, he found a small, hidden garden, lush and vibrant, a stark contrast to the urban surroundings. In the center stood a tree, its branches swaying gently despite the still air. Beneath it, a bench carved with intricate designs and symbols, ones he recognized from his childhood, symbols his sister loved to draw.

John approached the bench, and as he sat, the world around him seemed to fade away. He closed his eyes and felt a warmth enveloping him, a peace he hadn't felt since Emily's passing. Her voice came once more, this time from within, filling his mind with memories of laughter and love. "I'm always with you, John," the voice whispered, "Just listen."

He sat there, eyes closed, until the stars began to twinkle above. When he finally rose to leave, he felt different—lighter, as if a burden had been lifted. As he stepped back onto the street, he didn't turn left or right. Instead, he walked straight ahead, knowing that he carried a piece of Emily with him, a guiding light in the shadows of uncertainty. And for the first time in a long time, he felt sure of where he was going.
